description: Dhaka has a renowned culinary heritage. The city's culture is known for its rickshaws, biryani, art festivals and religious diversity.
The town is home to a number of tourist attractions, including the Mymensingh Museum, the Mymensingh Zoo, and the Mymensingh Rajbari.
The district has many historical monuments, relics and ancient mosques that are great places to visit. It also contains the largest mangrove forest in the world
Fine and cheap silk products of Rajshahi have earned it the nickname Silk City. Rajshahi is also well known for its fruits, especially for Mango and Lychee.
It has many popular attractions, including Foy's Lake, Guliakhali Sea Beach, Boga Lake, making it well worth a visit.
Barisal is one of the most important districts of the Ganges delta region, rich in rivers, canal-bills, forests and natural diversity.
There are also several handicraft cottage industries, including mat weaving and bamboo work. Tea estates southeast of Sylhet provide most of Bangladesh's yield.
Tourist Attractions in Rangpur Division 路 Tajhat Palace, Rangpur 路 Kantajew Temple, Dinajpur 路 Vinnya Jagat, Rangpur 路 Funcity Amusement Park, Thakurgaon.
